business.headline: Sensex tumbles over 900 points, Nifty ends below 23,000; IT, metal stocks crashThe S&P BSE Sensex tumbled 930.67 points to 75,364.69 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 tumbled 345.65 points to settle at 22,904.45.

IT stocks bleed as market crashes. Why TCS, Infosys, Wipro shares are down?All major IT stocks declined as fears of a US recession led to heavy selling. IT companies earn a large portion of their revenue from the US market, and concerns about a slowdown in technology spending have further weakened investor sentiment.

With 'fancy ice-cream' jab, Piyush Goyal's cold message to Shark Tank judgesPiyush Goyal row: While flagging the trend of Indian startups focusing on 'fancy ice creams' and food delivery apps, Piyush Goyal drew a parallel with China to pitch for more innovation in deep-tech.

RIL share price falls 4% ahead of Q4 results. Should you sell?Reliance Industries stock: RIL shares opened at Rs 1,240 and fell to an intraday low of Rs 1,192.85 in the afternoon session. The stock was close to its 52-week low of Rs 1,156, which it touched on March 3, 2025.

US tariffs stay at 26% as White House unveils new trade documentInitially, India's tariff rate was mentioned as 27% in the earlier version of the White House annex. However, the latest revision has adjusted it to 26%.

Withdrawing EPF? Know rules for marriage, education, home and medical needsIf you require money out of your EPF for the purposes of marriage or further studies, there are set regulations one needs to adhere to. You must have been an EPF member for at least seven years and must have at least Rs 1,000 in your EPF account.

Politicians need reality check, says Ashneer Grover on Piyush Goyal's startup remarkAshneer Grover has said that Indian politicians need a reality check after Piyush Goyal criticised startups for being too focused on food delivery apps.

Pension rules updates: 8 RBI guidelines every pensioner must knowIf a bank accidentally credits more pension than it should to a pensioner, then the bank must consult the Pension Sanctioning Authority before recovering the extra money.
Explained: Why Tata Motors share price has fallen 5% todayTata Motors share price: Tata Motors has gone down 8.68% in the last 5 days, 33.43% in the past month and 38.75% in the last year.

Piyush Goyal slams Indian startups, urges to shift focus from food delivery appsUnion Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal criticised India's startup ecosystem, saying it's too focused on food delivery, betting, and fantasy sports apps. In contrast, he praised Chinese startups for prioritising advanced tech like EVs, batteries, semiconductors, and AI, urging Indian innovators to shift toward deeper, tech-driven innovation.

Sensex crashes 1,000 points: 3 reasons behind today's stock market bloodbathStock market crash: The S&P BSE Sensex was down 965.90 points to 75,329.46, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 361.10 points to 22,889.00 as of 2:08 pm.

Storm of protest from startups after Minister Piyush Goyal's 'dukaandari' jibeStartup ecosystem leaders' response came after Piyush Goyal took a firm stance and said that while Indian startups were busy building food delivery platforms and fantasy gaming apps, those in countries like China were working on EVs, semiconductors, batteries, and AI.

entertainment.headline: Alia Bhatt's mother Soni reminisces old holiday memories with cute throwback picsActor Alia Bhatt's mother Soni Razdan became nostalgic on Friday, sharing old travel memories with her daughter. Soni shared a bunch of adorable throwback pictures with her 'Aloo', reminiscing about the memories attached to each.

Digitising emotions: Javed Akhtar on social media's revival of poetry | ExclusiveLyricist and screenwriter Javed Akhtar, in a conversation with India Today, spoke about the revival of poetry through social media, and how digital platforms have made Urdu poetry accessible to a younger audience worldwide.

Agnyathavasi trailer: A Kannada murder-mystery around realm of black magicProduced by Hemanth Rao, of Sapta Saagaradache Ello fame, Agnyathavasi is directed by Janardhan Chikanna and is scheduled to release in theatres on April 11, 2025. The trailer of the murder mystery was released on April 3.

Agnyathavasi trailer: A Kannada murder-mystery around realm of black magicProduced by Hemanth Rao, of Sapta Saagaradache Ello fame, Agnyathavasi is directed by Janardhan Chikanna and is scheduled to release in theatres on April 11, 2025. The trailer of the murder mystery was released on April 3.

'Shor' to silence: How Manoj Kumar carried India in his cinemaManoj Kumar's patriotism in cinema was something else. He didn't believe in the chest-thumping, hand-pump-uprooting or Pakistan-bashing patriotism of quintessential Bollywood. His enemy was the malice within.

Veteran Tamil-Malayalam actor Ravikumar Menon dies of cancer at 71Veteran actor Ravikumar Menon has died at the age of 71 in Chennai. Known for his roles in Tamil and Malayalam cinema, he left behind a legacy of diverse performances.

Actor Olivia Munn slams all-female Blue Origin space trip, calls it 'gluttonous'Actor Olivia Munn slammed the all-female Blue Origin space trip.The 44-year0old actor admitted how the upcoming trip seems 'gluttonous' when so many people 'can't even afford eggs.'

Empuraan smashes another box office record with Rs 100 crore worldwide shareL2: Empuraan has recorded a Rs 100 crore share worldwide, reported Mohanlal himself. The actor shared a celebratory post on X, highlighting the film's achievement.

Squid Game actor O Yeong-su sentenced to one year in prison for sexual assaultSquid Game actor O Yeong-su has been sentenced to prison for one year after he was accused of forcibly molesting a woman twice. The actor has pleaded not guilty in his appeal trial.

Allu Arjun-Atlee film announcement expected soon as Pushpa actor arrives in ChennaiDirector Atlee and actor Allu Arjun are joining hands for the first time. The Pushpa actor arrived in Chennai to hold a meeting with Atlee and Sun Pictures, the production house.

Shakira's 2025 Tour is here – Find out where she's performing in the USShakira expands her Las Mujeres Ya No Lloran World Tour, adding US dates. Fans can buy tickets from April 7. The tour celebrates Latin culture, unity, and record-breaking performances.

Khloé Kardashian and Tristan Thompson reunite for his brother Amari's birthdayKhloé Kardashian reunited with Tristan Thompson for his brother Amari's 18th birthday, emphasizing her close bond with his family. Despite their breakup, she continues to support Amari, whom Tristan now has legal custody of.

Empuraan: Voluntary or not, the cuts that shouldn't have beenEmpuraan's re-edited version trims two minutes to appease offended parties - an unnecessary sacrifice. This paradise of wounded people showcases our remarkable talent for manufacturing outrage from triviality.

Aamar Boss teaser: Raakhee Gulzar's comeback film promises heartfelt momentsThe teaser of Aamar Boss, which marks Raakhee Gulzar's return after 22 years and features Shiboprosad Mukherjee, is out. The film, directed by Nandita Roy and Shiboprosad Mukherjee, is set for a May 9 release, before Mother's Day.
MTV Video Music Awards to hit CBS screens for the first timeThe MTV Video Music Awards will air on CBS for the first time on Sept. 7, live from UBS Arena.
Sara Ali Khan visits Chandramouleshwara temple in KarnatakaActor Sara Ali Khan recently visited Chandramouleshwar Temple in Unkal. She shared pictures from the trip on social media.

Dhanush announces Idly Kadai release date with a special posterDhanush, who acted and helmed Idly Kadai, announced the film's release date with a poster. The film was earlier scheduled to release on April 10.

Rashmika Mandanna to celebrate 29th birthday in Oman with friendsPushpa star Rashmika Mandanna is all set to celebrate her 29th birthday in Oman. The actor was recently seen sharing screen space with Salman Khan in Sikandar.

It bothers me: Kim Sae-ron's leaked texts to Kim Soo-hyun hint at unhappy relationKorean actor Kim Soo-hyun continues to battle allegations about dating the late actor Kim Sae-ron when she was a minor. A set of new alleged text-exchanges alleges that she was not happy in their relationship.

general news.headline: 'Wish party good future': Annamalai bows out of Tamil Nadu BJP chief raceK Annamalai on Friday ruled himself out of the BJP's Tamil Nadu presidency race. This could be because the party reportedly plans a leadership change, amid reunion talks with the AIADMK and broader caste-based political strategy.

Avoid rhetoric that vitiates environment, ensure safety of Hindus: PM to YunusPM Modi's remarks come against the backdrop of Muhammad Yunus inviting China to expand its influence in India's Northeast. The comments were strongly denounced by India.

How Turkey's Hagia Sophia, once a cathedral, became Waqf propertyThe Hagia Sophia is at the centre of Turkey's Byzantine, Ottoman and secular history. How did the sixth-century cathedral become a Waqf property, get converted to a museum, and again a mosque? Tracing the history of the Hagia Sophia amid the Waqf Bill debate in India.

Waqf amendment bill owned the headlines, what's behind and beyond?After two days of hectic debates in both Houses, stretching well past midnight, the Waqf Amendment Bill passed the Parliament hurdle on Friday. In this article, we dive deep into the history of waqf, the provisions of the bill, and what the controversy is all about.

China slaps 34% additional tariff on US goods after Trump's sweeping trade moveThe move comes a day after Beijing urged Washington to withdraw its latest tariffs and warned of countermeasures to protect its own interests.

Waqf land 5% of India's area, more than big metro cities combinedThe Waqf Amendment Bill, passed by Parliament, aims to make the conversion and management of Waqf properties transparent and efficient. Waqf boards in India collectively hold 39 lakh acres, which is almost 5% of the country's land area and more than the combined land held by the armed forces and the Railways.

University of Bath School of Management: A Pathway to Global Career SuccessBath's School of Management blends top academics, hands-on learning, and career support to help students secure jobs at leading global companies.

Yunus raises Sheikh Hasina's extradition in 1st meet with PM amid strained tiesSources said Bangladesh sought a meeting between Muhammad Yunus and PM Modi on the sidelines of the BIMSTEC summit. The meeting comes amid strained ties between the neighbours.

MS Dhoni could lead CSK as Ruturaj Gaikwad doubtful for home game vs DelhiIPL 2025, CSK vs DC: Batting coach Michael Hussey said Ruturaj Gaikwad is in doubt to feature in Chennai's home game against Delhi on Saturday. MS Dhoni will lead CSK if Ruturaj isn't fit.
Bollywood, influencers swear by raw milk for skincare. But do experts approve?From celeb routines to Instagram trends, raw milk is the latest age-old skincare obsession.

Ghost-writing to becoming India's Bharat Kumar: Iconic legacy of Manoj KumarLegendary actor Manoj Kumar died on Friday at around 3.30 am in Mumbai. He was 87. We trace his journey in this tribute piece, highlighting what he really stood for.

Asaduddin Owaisi challenges Waqf bill in top court: Violates rights of MuslimsCongress MP Mohammad Jawed has filed the first legal challenge to the Waqf Amendment Act in the Supreme Court, arguing it violates constitutional rights including equality, religious freedom, minority protection, and property rights.

Test review: Madhavan, Nayanthara and Siddharth hit sixes, but don't win the matchReleased-Fri Apr 04, 2025Test movie review: Producer-turned-director Sashikanth's 'Test', starring Madhavan, Siddharth and Nayanthara, is a sports drama about a winner and a loser. The trio's star power failed to deliver an enjoyable innings.

When Manoj Kumar filed defamation case against SRK: He has injured my soulVeteran actor Manoj Kumar was upset with a scene in the 2007 film Om Shanti Om, leading to legal action against Shah Rukh Khan and director Farah Khan. Despite an apology and promises to remove the scene, the issue resurfaced in 2013 when the film was re-released in Japan with the scene intact.

Punjab woman constable caught with 17 grams of heroin in TharConstable Amandeep Kaur was arrested with 17.71 grams of heroin as part of the state government's ongoing anti-drug campaign, 'Yudh Nasheian Virudh' (War Against Drugs).

Top court allows Yasin Malik to cross-examine witnesses via video conferencingA bench of Justices Abhay S Oka and Ujjal Bhuyan, while partly allowing the CBI's plea, overturned a Jammu trial court order that had directed Malik to be physically produced for cross-examination.

Domestic car market to grow by 1-2% in FY26 on high base, say industry leadersAlthough India was able to better its own performance in FY25, the growth was less than 3% y-o-y, and it could be hit further in FY26.

Martin Luther King Jr.: The man, his mission, and the aftermath of his assassinationOn April 4, 1968, Nobel Peace Prize awardee Martin Luther King Jr. was assassinated in Memphis, triggering riots across the US. His death shook the civil rights movement but also cemented his legacy in the fight for justice.

Satellite images confirm deforestation in Hyderabad's Kancha Gachibowli areaSatellite images show the deforestation near Hyderabad Central University for an IT park in Telangana. The felling of trees sparked outrage, leading to student protests and Supreme Court intervention amid questions over environmental clearance and the ecological sensitivity of Kancha Gachibowli region.

'Daredevil' US man who entered Andaman's restricted island met Taliban previouslyAmerican YouTuber Mykhailo Viktorovych Polyakov, was arrested for attempting to make contact with one of the world's most isolated tribes on North Sentinel Island, had previously visited Taliban-controlled Afghanistan and shared videos.

Karnataka BJP worker dies by suicide, blames Congress leaders, police in death noteA 35-year-old BJP worker from Karnataka's Madikeri, Vinay Somayya, allegedly died by suicide in Bengaluru after an FIR was filed against him. In his note, he blamed Congress leaders and accused the police of harassment.

Flexible Sudharshan opens up about batting mantra in era of fast-paced T20sGujarat Titans opener Sai Sudharsan opened up on the mindset behind his consistent run in IPL 2025, stressing the importance of being versatile with the bat and adapting to different match situations rather than chasing big totals blindly.

GT's Jos Buttler feeling 'lighter' after quitting England captaincyGujarat Titans star Jos Buttler said that he feels 'lighter' after relinquishing England's white-ball captaincy. Buttler quit the role after England's poor performance in the Champions Trophy earlier this year.

India to have training centres for 10 sports as part of preparationIndia are on the way to setting up training centres for 10 sports as a part of preparations for the Olympics 2036. Last year, the Indian Olympic Association submitted India's formal bid to host the quadrennial event.

Jimmy Butler is great. He adds a Championship DNA, LeBron James reacts to Warriors' bold tradeLeBron James praises Butler after the Golden State Warriors defeated the Los Angeles Lakers at Crypto.com Arena, on Thursday, April 4, during the NBA regular game in a thriller 123-116.

NBA: Jimmy Butler injury scare during Warriors vs Lakers raises concern ahead of playoffsGolden State Warriors forward Jimmy Butler left the game on Thursday, April 3, during the NBA regular game at Crypto.com Arena with a potential left arm injury.

Kevin de Bruyne announces exit from Manchester City, to leave in summerManchester City's star midfielder Kevin de Bruyne has announced his exit from the club. De Bruyne will be leaving the club as a free agent in the summer.

NBA: Stephen Curry shares postgame moment with David Beckham after Warriors defeat LakersThe Golden State Warriors secured a crucial 123–116 victory over the Los Angeles Lakers on Thursday night, tightening the race for playoff seeding in the Western Conference.

SRK texts KKR after SRH win, sends special message to Venkatesh IyerShah Rukh Khan sent a personal message to KKR players, including a motivating note to Venkatesh Iyer as vice-captain, silenced his price-tag critics with a crucial knock to beat SRH in Kolkata.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
